DOCNAME: CASE OF ANATOLIY TARASOV v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 8;No violation of Art. 34;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is serving a prison sentence in correctional colony IK-CARDINAL in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in the town of GPE on suspicion of murder and several robberies . He was searched and police officers allegedly withheld his money and jewellery and beat him up . They took him to GPE town police station where the beatings allegedly continued .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant was charged with aggravated robbery , murder , unlawful detention of an individual , extortion , unlawful possession of firearms and use of force against a ORG official DATE offences under ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW . The applicant was placed in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE found the applicant guilty of robbery committed with a view to acquiring others ' property on a large scale and accompanied by infliction of grievous bodily harm on the victim ( LAW ( b ) and ( c ) ) ; unlawful detention of a person entailing grave consequences ( LAW ) ; murder with a lucrative aim accompanied by a robbery ( LAW ( i ) ) ; extortion aimed at acquisition of others ' property on a large scale ( LAW § CARDINAL ( b ) ) ; unlawful possession of a firearm ( LAW ) and assault on a ORG official ( LAW ) . The court established that the applicant had instigated his CARDINAL co - defendants to rob employees of a trading company . Accompanied by the co - defendants and carrying a firearm , the applicant had stopped the employees ' car , had robbed them , tied them to a tree in the forest and shot CARDINAL of them dead . The court further found that the applicant had blackmailed another victim , extorting a sum of money from him and had assaulted police officers during his arrest . The court based the applicant 's conviction on testimonies by his co - defendants , the surviving victims and witnesses and the material evidence . The applicant was sentenced to DATE imprisonment . He appealed against the judgment .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant was transferred to remand centre SIZO-CARDINAL in GPE in order to secure his presence at the appeal hearing . He was allegedly placed in a cell where he was severely beaten by other inmates .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the applicant 's conviction on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE a deputy Prosecutor General of GPE lodged with the Presidium of ORG of GPE an application for supervisory review of the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The prosecutor requested a different legal characterisation of the applicant 's criminal acts , in particular that the charge of “ unlawful detention of an individual by an organised group ” under LAW of LAW be reclassified as “ unlawful detention of CARDINAL or more individuals by a group of persons with the use of weapons and violence dangerous to [ their ] health ” under LAW ( a ) , ( c ) , ( d ) and ( h ) . Furthermore , he requested that the charge of “ murder for financial gain coupled with robbery ” under LAW be reclassified as “ murder coupled with robbery ” under the same provision .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , a copy of the prosecutor 's application was sent to the applicant “ simultaneously ” and on DATE he was informed that the hearing before the ORG was scheduled for DATE . They further submitted that the applicant had been subsequently notified that the hearing had been postponed . The copy of the application of the deputy Prosecutor General produced by the ORG contained handwritten notes : “ postponed [ signature ] CARDINAL . ” , “ postponed [ signature ] CARDINAL ” , “ postponed CARDINAL [ signature ] ” .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he obtained a copy of the deputy Prosecutor General 's application only on DATE . On unspecified dates the applicant sent to ORG and the Presidium of ORG his observations in connection with the prosecutor 's application . He also sought leave to appear at the supervisory review hearing . It appears that his requests were left without reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG of GPE examined the application . After having heard the prosecutor and the judge rapporteur and examined the materials of the case , the ORG granted the request , reclassified the applicant 's acts as sought by the prosecutor and reduced the sentence to DATE imprisonment . The ORG court 's decision contained no reference to the applicant 's observations or arguments raised therein . The applicant did not attend the hearing .
CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant was held in colony PERSON in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to give notice of the application to the Government of GPE .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE and sent through informal channels , the applicant informed the ORG that on DATE wardens PERSON . , PERSON . and PERSON had had a conversation with him . According to the applicant , they told him that the ORG had started its examination of the application lodged by PERSON and that they did not want the applicant to complain about conditions of detention in NORP correctional GPE to ORG . They ordered him to write statements addressed to Mr PERSON , head of ORG in GPE , and to Mr ORG , a prosecutor . The applicant was to affirm that he had no complaints about the conditions of detention . The applicant refused and allegedly endured beatings for DATE and received death threats . According to the applicant , there was no physical evidence of ill - treatment because he had been refused access to a doctor . On DATE the applicant gave up and signed the declarations .
CARDINAL . In his letter of CARDINAL DATE he requested the ORG not to accept any statement similar to the above , should the Government produce one .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG informed the applicant that notice of his application had been given to ORG . The applicant was invited to designate a representative in the proceedings before the ORG . The letter contained several enclosures , such as a statement of facts , questions to the parties , an information note to applicants on the proceedings after communication of an application , an authority form and a list of NORP bar associations to which the applicant could apply for representation before the ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP By letter dated CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed the ORG that on CARDINAL DATE a co - detainee had handed him the ORG 's letter of CARDINAL DATE . The envelope had been unsealed . It contained the letter and the questions to the parties . Considering that certain documents were missing , the applicant requested the prison administration to explain why the letter had been opened . According to the applicant , on DATE he had been placed for DATE in so - called “ ORG cell - type premises ” [ помещение камерного типа ] with a stricter prison regime because of his questions .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained of censorship to the head of the colony who initiated an inquiry .
CARDINAL . On DATE officer PERSON submitted to the head of the colony an explanation which , in its relevant parts , read as follows :

“ I hereby notify you that on DATE a letter ( incoming no . CARDINAL ) in a foreign language for convict PERSON [ the applicant ] was received . I examined [ the letter ] . The documents in the envelope were inspected and put back into the envelope ; they were not withheld . Other persons did not have access to the above letter and on DATE it was handed over against receipt to PERSON . , head of the brigade ... ”

“ On DATE at TIME officer PERSON handed over to me a big envelope addressed to [ the applicant ] . The envelope was opened , I examined [ рассмотрел ] the documents contained therein and put them back . There were no documents in NORP there . I gave the envelope to GPE , the inmate on duty , for him to pass it to [ the applicant ] . I did not remove any documents from the envelope and did not give them to persons other than GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE inmate PERSON submitted to the head of the colony an explanation worded in the following terms :

“ I ... handed over to [ the applicant ] a big envelope which had been given to me by PERSON . , head of the brigade . TIME after the envelope was given to me I handed it over to [ the applicant ] . I did not look into the envelope and did not take any documents out of it , I did not give the envelope to anybody . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the acting head of the colony delivered a report [ заключение ] . It stated that in course of the inquiry it had been established that on CARDINAL DATE the colony had received an envelope for the applicant with documents from ORG . Officer PERSON in charge of censoring the inmates ' correspondence had automatically opened the envelope , not noticing the logo of ORG . After the inspection [ осмотр ] of the documents she had put them back into the envelope and had passed it over to PERSON . , head of the applicant 's brigade , who was supposed to hand it over to the applicant . The report concluded that PERSON had breached LAW of LAW prohibiting censorship of convicts ' correspondence with ORG . The report went on suggesting , among other things , reprimanding PERSON for negligence and conducting study courses on LAW with the colony officers , followed by obligatory tests .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG requested the ORG to submit further observations in connection with the censorship of the ORG 's letter and the alleged intimidation of the applicant .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the regional office of ORG in GPE opened an inquiry in connection with the ORG 's communication of the applicant 's complaints to the Government .
CARDINAL . On DATE the regional prosecutor questioned the applicant . His explanation , in so far as relevant , read :

“ On DATE at CARDINAL on duty inmate PERSON handed over to me an opened envelope with the logo of the ORG ; there were CARDINAL sheets of paper with a text in LANGUAGE . He told me that he had received the envelope from PERSON .. At lunch I asked PERSON . why the envelope had been opened . He answered that he had been given the opened envelope by the censor ...
From the text of the documents I understood that not all documents had been given to me ; in particular , some documents which I was supposed to fill in and to return to the ORG were missing ...

I think that the missing documents ... had been withheld by the representatives of the administration of PERSON . I can not name specific persons because I do n't know who they were . My suspicions in respect of the administration are based on the fact that directly after my complaint to Ya . , deputy head of the colony , the administration acted in a strange way . Instead of attempting to find out what had happened to the missing documents , they placed me in a ORG . I think that if the administration had had nothing to do with the loss of the documents they would not be acting like that ...

... In PERSON I was not pressurised directly . However it looks suspicious to me that I have suddenly become a persistent regime breaker . It is also alarming that measures are taken with a view to delaying my incoming correspondence from the ORG and my outgoing correspondence . The attachments to the ORG letter opened in DATE may have been withheld with this aim . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the regional office of ORG issued a report in which they acknowledged a breach of the rules concerning the confidentiality of the applicant 's correspondence with the ORG . At the same time it was noted that it had not been confirmed that documents had been removed from the ORG 's envelope . It was further stated , with reference to the explanations of PERSON , the then acting head of the colony , and PERSON . , that PERSON had automatically opened the envelope , that she had not read the documents and that , in any event , she did not speak LANGUAGE . Had she noticed ORG logo , she would not have unsealed the envelope . Neither she nor other persons had removed the documents from the envelope ; no such directions had ever been given to anybody . It had been impossible to reprimand PERSON because by the relevant time her employment had already been terminated because of general measures to reduce the workforce .

CARDINAL . As regards the applicant 's allegation of pressure with a view to making him withdraw some of his complaints to the ORG , the report noted that , according to his own explanation , he had only raised the issue of interference with his communication with the ORG in connection with the opening of the ORG 's letter . He had not referred to any other instances of intimidation or interference .

CARDINAL . Lastly , during his detention before his conviction had become final he had been reprimanded CARDINAL times for various breaches of the detention regime . After the conviction had become final the applicant breached the prison regime on CARDINAL occasions : he was placed in a punishment cell , CARDINAL times , in a PKT twice , and was reprimanded CARDINAL times .
CARDINAL . By a final judgment of DATE the applicant was convicted of having publicly assaulted a public official .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date he was transferred to serve his prison sentence to correctional colony IK-CARDINAL in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , while giving notice of the applicant 's complaints about the opening of its letter and the applicant 's alleged intimidation under LAW , of its own motion , raised the issue of whether the prison authorities censored the applicant 's correspondence , in breach of LAW .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , during his stay in ORG the prison administration routinely censored his incoming mail from the domestic authorities that was not subject to censorship by virtue of the domestic law .

CARDINAL . NORP In particular , the applicant referred to the incoming mail from the following authorities : the Ombudsman of GPE ( letters of DATE and DATE ) , ORG of GPE ( letter of CARDINAL DATE ) , ORG with the President of GPE ( letter of DATE ) , ORG ( letters of DATE and DATE ) , the prosecutor 's office of GPE ( letters of DATE and CARDINAL DATE ) , ORG of GPE ( letter of DATE ) , ORG of GPE ( letter of DATE ) , the department of ORG in GPE ( letters of CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL and DATE and DATE ) , the LOC court ( letter of DATE ) .

CARDINAL . The letter of ORG dated DATE was addressed to the head of PERSON . He was requested to notify the applicant that ORG had examined the applicant 's complaint , forwarded to them by ORG GPE , and dismissed it as unfounded .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of LAW of Criminal Procedure , in force at the material time , a prosecutor took part in a hearing before a supervisory review court . A convict and his or her counsel could be summoned if the court found it necessary . If summoned , they were to be afforded an opportunity to take cognisance of the application for supervisory review and to make oral submissions at the hearing . By its ruling of DATE , ORG declared LAW unconstitutional in so far as it allowed a supervisory instance court to examine the case without providing the convicted or acquitted person and their counsel with an opportunity to know the contents of the request for supervisory review lodged by the prosecutor , if the latter sought annulment of the final judgment on grounds unfavourable to that person . ORG made the same findings in respect of the lack of a legal requirement to notify the convicted or acquitted person and their counsel of the time when and place where the supervisory review hearing would take place . Failing that , the above persons would be unable to state their position to the court .

CARDINAL . A supervisory review court was not bound by the scope of the application for supervisory review and was under an obligation to review the criminal case in its entirety ( LAW . It could uphold , amend or quash any of the earlier judgments , vary the sentence , discontinue the criminal proceedings or remit the matter for new consideration by the trial or appeal court . It could not , however , increase the sentence or re - categorise the defendant 's actions as a more serious offence ( ibid . ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , as amended on DATE , as well as LAW adopted on DATE by Decree no . CARDINAL of the Russian Ministry of Justice , provide that all detainees ' incoming and outgoing correspondence is subject to censorship by the administration of the correctional facility . Correspondence with courts , prosecutors , penitentiary officials , the ORG , the public monitoring board and ORG is not subject to censorship .
